newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico key Cetes rate closes lower on liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Mexico key Cetes rate closes lower on liquidity.

text.p: Mexico's three-day Cetes rate, the Friday equivalent of same-day Cetes rate, closed lower in a trading session marked by high liquidity and volume, dealers said.
The benchmark rate on the secondary money market MXAAB fell 50 basis poinits to 23.50 percent.

"The market has been very stable these days because foreign money keeps coming in, mostly from those who had positions in Brazil and Argentina," one dealer said. "The volume has concentrated in short-term paper."

Rates one-month paper also closed lower, down 10 basis points to 23.90 percent. But rates on 91-day Cetes climbed 100 basis points to 27.50 percent and 10 basis points on six-month paper to 29.10 percent.
Rates for bank notes and acceptances rose 25 basis points to 24.75 percent.
